Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: kafkactl

Arguments.Name: attach
Arguments.Description: Run kafkactl pod in kubernetes and attach to it

Arguments.Name: cg
Arguments.Description: Clone existing consumerGroup with all offsets

Arguments.Name: topic
Arguments.Description: Clone existing topic (number of partitions, replication factor, config entries) to new one

Arguments.Name: --exit
Arguments.Description: Stop consuming when latest offset is reached

Arguments.Name: --from-beginning
Arguments.Description: Set offset for consumer to the oldest offset

Arguments.Name: --key-encoding
Arguments.Description: Key encoding (auto-detected by default). One of: none|hex|base64

Arguments.Name: --max-messages
Arguments.Description: Stop consuming after n messages have been read

Arguments.Name: --offset
Arguments.Description: Offsets in format `partition=offset (for partitions not specified, other parameters apply)`

Arguments.Name: --partitions
Arguments.Description: Partitions to consume. The default is to consume from all partitions

Arguments.Name: --print-schema
Arguments.Description: Print details about avro schema used for decoding

Arguments.Name: --proto-file
Arguments.Description: Additional protobuf description file for searching message description

Arguments.Name: --proto-import-path
Arguments.Description: Additional path to search files listed in proto 'import' directive

Arguments.Name: --protoset-file
Arguments.Description: Additional compiled protobuf description file for searching message description

Arguments.Name: --separator
Arguments.Description: Separator to split key and value

Arguments.Name: --tail
Arguments.Description: Show only the last n messages on the topic

Arguments.Name: --value-encoding
Arguments.Description: Value encoding (auto-detected by default). One of: none|hex|base64

Arguments.Name: --group
Arguments.Description: Create acl for a consumer group

Arguments.Name: --pattern
Arguments.Description: Pattern type. one of (match, prefixed, literal)

Arguments.Name: --newest
Arguments.Description: Set the offset to newest offset (for all partitions or the specified partition)

Arguments.Name: --offset
Arguments.Description: Set offset to this value. offset with value -1 is ignored

Arguments.Name: --oldest
Arguments.Description: Set the offset to oldest offset (for all partitions or the specified partition)

Arguments.Name: --partition
Arguments.Description: Partition to create group for. -1 stands for all partitions

Arguments.Name: --topic
Arguments.Description: One or more topics to create group for

Arguments.Name: --groups
Arguments.Description: Delete acl for a consumer group

Arguments.Name: --pattern
Arguments.Description: Pattern type. one of (any, match, prefixed, literal)

Arguments.Name: --partition
Arguments.Description: Delete offset for this partition. -1 stands for all partitions

Arguments.Name: --only-with-lag
Arguments.Description: Show only partitions that have a lag

Arguments.Name: --topic
Arguments.Description: Show group details for given topic only

Arguments.Name: --skip-empty
Arguments.Description: Show only partitions that have a messages

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: Get info about topics, consumerGroups, acls, brokers

Arguments.Name: --pattern
Arguments.Description: Pattern type. one of (any, match, prefixed, literal)

Arguments.Name: --topic
Arguments.Description: Show groups for given topic only

Arguments.Name: --key
Arguments.Description: Key to use for all messages

Arguments.Name: --key-encoding
Arguments.Description: Key encoding (none by default). One of: none|hex|base64

Arguments.Name: --key-schema-version
Arguments.Description: Avro schema version that should be used for key serialization (default is latest)

Arguments.Name: --lineSeparator
Arguments.Description: Separator to split multiple messages from stdin or file

Arguments.Name: --max-message-bytes
Arguments.Description: The maximum permitted size of a message (defaults to 1000000)

Arguments.Name: --null-value
Arguments.Description: Produce a null value (can be used instead of providing a value with --value)

Arguments.Name: --partitioner
Arguments.Description: The partitioning scheme to use. Can be `murmur2`, `hash`, `hash-ref` `manual`, or `random`. (default is murmur2)

Arguments.Name: --proto-file
Arguments.Description: Additional protobuf description file for searching message description

Arguments.Name: --proto-import-path
Arguments.Description: Additional path to search files listed in proto 'import' directive

Arguments.Name: --protoset-file
Arguments.Description: Additional compiled protobuf description file for searching message description

Arguments.Name: --rate
Arguments.Description: Amount of messages per second to produce on the topic

Arguments.Name: --required-acks
Arguments.Description: Required acks. One of `NoResponse`, `WaitForLocal`, `WaitForAll`. (default is WaitForLocal)

Arguments.Name: --separator
Arguments.Description: Separator to split key and value from stdin or file

Arguments.Name: --silent
Arguments.Description: Do not write to standard output

Arguments.Name: --value-encoding
Arguments.Description: Value encoding (none by default). One of: none|hex|base64

Arguments.Name: --value-schema-version
Arguments.Description: Avro schema version that should be used for value serialization (default is latest)

Arguments.Name: --all-topics
Arguments.Description: Do the operation for all topics in the consumer group

Arguments.Name: --execute
Arguments.Description: Execute the reset (as default only the results are displayed for validation)

Arguments.Name: --newest
Arguments.Description: Set the offset to newest offset (for all partitions or the specified partition)

Arguments.Name: --offset
Arguments.Description: Set offset to this value. offset with value -1 is ignored

Arguments.Name: --oldest
Arguments.Description: Set the offset to oldest offset (for all partitions or the specified partition)

Arguments.Name: --partition
Arguments.Description: Partition to apply the offset. -1 stands for all partitions

Arguments.Name: --topic
Arguments.Description: One ore more topics to change offset for

Arguments.Name: attach
Arguments.Description: Run kafkactl pod in kubernetes and attach to it

Arguments.Name: cg
Arguments.Description: Clone existing consumerGroup with all offsets

Arguments.Name: topic
Arguments.Description: Clone existing topic (number of partitions, replication factor, config entries) to new one

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: Get info about topics, consumerGroups, acls, brokers
